author: Mollie Russell
description:
‘Do something you love, and you’ll never work a day in your life.’ It’s an all-too-familiar cliche, and it’s one that, in 2025’s rather hostile economy, many might challenge. Despite this, the goal of many creative people is still to turn their hobbies into a career. This is true of artists, dancers, authors – and, increasingly, Dungeons and Dragons players.

Continue reading The meteoric rise of the professional Dungeons and Dragons DM
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: The meteoric rise of the professional Dungeons and Dragons DM

author: Jasmine Mannan
description:
While there are countless Lego Star Wars sets to get your brick fix from, any long-time collector will tell you to wait and buy them during the sales. Right now, you can grab the LEGO Star Wars: The Phantom Menace Mos ESPA Podrace Diorama for a juicy 30% off - so you may want to start making some room on your shelves.

Continue reading Get 30% off this stunning Lego Star Wars diorama while you still can
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Biggest LEGO sets, LEGO sets for adults, Best Star Wars LEGO sets
title: Get 30% off this stunning Lego Star Wars diorama while you still can

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The upcoming Final Fantasy Magic set has been in the works for many years, so it makes sense that its final design looks a lot different to its first. According to a recent article posted by Wizards of the Coast, there were loads of interesting mechanics planned for Final Fantasy that were dropped along the way - including a card type that Magic fans have been waiting to see return for ages.

Continue reading MTG Final Fantasy cut Battles and a villainous monologue mechanic
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: MTG Final Fantasy cut Battles and a villainous monologue mechanic

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Warhammer 40k has long been at the forefront of model kit design for the miniature game market, with kits that combine a fun building experience, loads of options, and a final product that both looks great and plays well on the tabletop. But the game’s dominance is about to be shaken by Bandai's upcoming Gundam Assemble wargame - team Wargamer has built some test models, and they’re simply superb.

Continue reading The new Gundam wargame's miniatures are lightyears ahead of Warhammer 40k
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets, Best Warhammer 40k games, All Warhammer 40k factions
title: The new Gundam wargame's miniatures are lightyears ahead of Warhammer 40k

author: Matt Bassil
description:
06/06/2025 Drat! Looks like it's already out of stock. Bookmark the link though, as it may come back in the future.

If you want to secure some packs of the next Pokémon TCG release ahead of schedule then you’d better act fast. There’s a preorder deal going at Target right now, but we’ve no way of knowing how long it’ll be in stock for.

Continue reading Snag four packs of the new Black & White Pokémon cards with this Target deal

title: Snag four packs of the new Black & White Pokémon cards with this Target deal

author: Mollie Russell
description:
A new roll-and-write board game began crowdfunding on Kickstarter on June 3, and its main inspiration is the PC classic Civilization. Rise of the Oak Dell is the third game in a series of PC-gaming-inspired tabletop titles published by Two Acorn Games. It’s also ultra-affordable, with a full pledge costing $13.70 (€12 / £11).

Continue reading This Civilization-inspired roll-and-write board game costs less than a pizza
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games, Best board games for adults, Best 2-player board games
title: This Civilization-inspired roll-and-write board game costs less than a pizza
